instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: I had 8.5V at the boost circuit output, I have changed the backlight driver and wired the missing feedback line. When I connect the feedback wire input fuse is failing, Not sure why. I don't see any short at output

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
So you get image, only missing backlight?
Post diode mode to ground at both pins of D7701; w/ and w/o LCD connected.

Any history available?

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
Voltages at diode mode with respect to ground 
Without display - 0.610V and 0.417V
With display - 0.607V and 0.416V

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
Be sure to connect feedback trace correctly.
And change U7701.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
[ATTACH type="full"]59880[/ATTACH]

Look at the feedback pin and the missing pins, I think its an impossible task to solder the missing line ,

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
I don't understand what is the problem there.
R/C7704 looks good as their trace to U7701 too.

When feedback is broken (XW7720), this is what you need to do.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/18UR9ufMnaWRTbwZwNjTTxmIcHGCNpSBl/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: I am sorry, I didn’t understand that picture, could you give me bit more information?

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
Compare it with boardview; then run corresponding wire.
We have posted XW7720 pictures on the forum...

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
I have made a connection from the xw7720 n via to D7701cathode.
When I connect the screen I get 0V at o/p, Still, the display image is there.
But Q7706 is not turning ON. Q7706 gate has 8.2V. 
When I check Q7707 Gate - the 5th pin is 0V and the 2nd pin is 3.3V.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
So missing EDP_BKLT_EN signal.
"I had 8.5V at the boost circuit output"
Impossible without that signal.
Fuse gets burnt again?

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Yes earlier I had 8.5V , that was before fixing the feed back issue. I have also changed the driver IC . Fuse is good now

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
Re-check all you done there.
Be sure didn't run wire between traces in wrong way.

Here some pictures.

[ATTACH alt="xw7720 fix.jpg"]59881[/ATTACH][ATTACH alt="XW7720_.jpg"]59882[/ATTACH]

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Confirm continuity with schematic...

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Yes the o/p has connection to the feed back pin of driver IC

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Still missing EDP_BKLT_EN?

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
Now I can see both BKLT_PLT_RST_L and EDP_BKLT_EN are present and 3.3 V but Q7706 is not functioning I mean I get 0V at PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT_FET. And 8.3V at PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLTFET.
I don't have Q7707 MOSFETs spare. Am I allowed to connect LCDBKLT_EN_DIV_L directly to Ground for testing purpose?

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Yes, the problem solved, I have shorted the 1st and 6th pins of  Q7707. Found the backlight is present. Then I have replaced the Q7707 with a new one. Now it's perfect. Thanks for the support

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
Why not LCDBKLT_EN_L???
Bypass pins 1/3 of Q7707.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: However the issue is resolved. Apparently the driver IC and Q7707 were faulty. Replaced both and it's working perfectly☺️

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: When I closed the laptop observed that the system is booting up but the keyboard and trackpad are not working.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Also, i have noticed the fan is running at full speed. keyboard backlight is glowing

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Looks like the flex cable contact is bad, I have tried to fix it and inserted again. Now I don't see the backlight anymore, Basically, EDP_BKLT_EN is missing. But still, there is a chime sound. When I bypassed Q7707 the entire screen is white.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Check SMC_LID signal.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: smc_lid  - I have disconnected the flex cable --- >  Voltage is 3.4V when the display LID is open. Voltage is 0 when the LID is closed. Still, I don't see a backlight. I am testing without flex able. And I have ordered a new cable. Does this cable and backlight are related ???

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
Do you talk about LIO flex?
You should get image/backlight without it.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: I am talking about IPD flex (J4800). Will image or /backlight get without this cable?

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: You must get image without trackpad also.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Ohh is it ? , Then what would be the reason for backlight missing, I don’t see EDP_BKLT_EN. It’s 0V

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
Missing image at same time?
DP_INT_HPD stays high?

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: I don't think there is any image on the screen. At least I can't see anything on the screen. But there is 24.7V on PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT. Apple logo light at the[B] backside of the lid [/B]is glowing now.  DP_INT_HPD   is continuously varying between 2.45V to 2.55V.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
So the backlight circuit works; 25V is correct output.

Try known good working LCD assembly.
If still no image, check diode mode to ground on all data video lines.
Also be sure all the caps are in place and have good traces.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: I have removed and connected the board , hdd and all the connections. Now good news is image and backlight is there. I suspect something were wrong with smc/Pram memory. The touchpad flex cable might had a short internally. I don’t want to try this broken cable anymore. Ordered new one. Waiting for it.

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message:
Does the machine work correctly now?
Fan spins normal, macOS isn't slow?

threads.title: A1466 No back light
threads.message: Yes, everything solved, Fan connecter was lost, Then I have removed and cleaned the display connector. Now the system works perfectly so far

threads.title: A1466 No back light
